title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.3: COMMUNITY Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) PRACTICES

description.narrative: By 2020, communities living in targeted areas have a better understanding of the benefits of good hygiene practices, particularly the use of toilets, the consumption of quality water and the practice of hand washing with soap., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end 2020, women, adolescents and children including the most vulnerable utilize equitable and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in rural areas in times of stability and crisis.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, communities living in targeted areas have a better understanding of the benefits of good hygiene practices, particularlythe use of toilets, the consumption of quality water and the practice of hand washing with soap.

description.narrative: The COVID-19 emergency enabled the office to intensify the promotion of good hygiene practices; 12,114 students from 181 schools benefited from awareness sessions on handwashing and good hygiene practices, as part of the COVID-19 protocols after the schools reopening. In addition, the Country Office contributed to Key Results for Children in West and Central Africa (KRCs), particularly KRC 8 with 270 communities certified as Open Defecation Free (ODF), representing at least 148,000 additional people. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:26/01/2021
